pr_title: Upgrade to latest version of Sync and Core

timeline.message: Upgrade to latest version of Sync and Core

timeline.author: nhachicha
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1765,36 +1765,40 @@ public void asJSON() throws JSONException {
         String json = all.asJSON();
         final String expectedJSON = "[\n" +
                 "    {\n" +
+                "        \"_key\":100," +
                 "        \"columnString\": \"alltypes1\",\n" +
                 "        \"columnLong\": 1337,\n" +
                 "        \"columnFloat\": 3.1400001,\n" +
                 "        \"columnDouble\": 0.89122999999999997,\n" +
                 "        \"columnBoolean\": false,\n" +
                 "        \"columnDate\": \"" + now + "\",\n" +
-                "        \"columnBinary\": \"010203\",\n" +
+                "        \"columnBinary\": \"AQID\",\n" +

replies.bodyText: No idea, but it concerned me a bit as well. I'll ask Core about it
replies.author: cmelchior

replies.bodyText: Binary data is now Base64 encoded apparently. I'll add a mention in the changelog. Normally it would be considered a breaking change as you removed the @Beta label on the asJson() method, but since it is also mentioned that the method is only for debugging it is probably acceptable? WDYT?
replies.author: cmelchior

timeline.author: nhachicha

replies.bodyText: It is an optional setting set through Realm.init(context, userAgent)
replies.author: cmelchior

replies.bodyText: is this exposed for test? who needed this override?
replies.author: nhachicha

replies.bodyText:
It was added in this PR: #6270
It looks like we don't have automatic tests for it, but only verified the behavior manually.
replies.author: cmelchior
